page.title: 18St.Levan
page.content: She took us to a watermill.The water mill still works and it is used to make electricity. It used to be for grinding wheat and barley.The lady said it was nine hundred years old and the gears were made of applewood. We were amazed when she told us how old the watermill was and then we said we had to go.So we said "Thank you " We went to another house and we saw a lady outside we asked our questions and she said she enjoyed answering them and said thank you.Then she asked if we had ever seen a honeycomb before we said "No" .So then she went in and got one to show us. In the afternoon we performed our Penrose play and talked to the St.Levan children.We enjoyed our visit to St.Levan very much.
